key_risks: Regulatory and political risks in emerging markets
Supply chain vulnerabilities due to geopolitical tensions and logistical disruptions
Project delays due to permitting issues and logistical challenges
controversies: Environmental impact of projects in sensitive ecosystems
Land acquisition practices and displacement of local communities
environmental_issues: Environmental impact of renewable energy projects in sensitive ecosystems
social_issues: Displacement of local communities due to land acquisition
Disputes with subcontractors affecting local labor
governance_issues: Insider trading activities by board members

sources.title: ESG Performance Report - Scatec Annual report 2023
sources.snippet: Scatec assesses material sustainability related impacts, risks and opportunities according to the concept of double mate-riality in the ESRS. The double materiality assessment has a dual focus by investigating both an organisation's impact on environment, people and society and how different ESG topics financially impact the company.

sources.title: Managing environmental and social impact - annualreport2020.scatec.com
sources.snippet: Scatec ASA - Sustainability Report 2020 19 Environmental and Social Management System We follow standardised processes in all our projects to identify, mitigate and monitor our potential risks and impacts. This work forms part of our corporate Environmental and Social Management System (ESMS). Environmental and Social Impact Assessments

sources.title: ESG Performance Report - Scatec Annual report 2022
sources.snippet: Environment Scatec conducts environmental and social (E&S) risk and impact identification for all projects throughout the business develop-ment phase in the form of desktop screening (decision gate (DG) 0-1), due diligences and impact assessments (DG1.5). Following, planning for managing these risks and impacts commences at DG1.5.

sources.snippet: Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive. Scatec initiated its readiness assessment to the CSRD requirements in second quarter 2023. sources.title: Climate Impact - Scatec Annual Report 2021
sources.snippet: Climate change is a global challenge that Scatec's core business aims to address. Policymakers are increasingly looking to renewable energy when tendering for new power generation to tackle climate change and due to declining costs. Scatec's main purpose is to develop solar, wind and hydro power plants to meet this need.

sources.title: Scatec exits Vietnam with sale of 39-MW wind plant
sources.snippet: The transaction will close within the first half of 2025. Norwegian power producer Scatec ASA is set to exit the Vietnamese market after agreeing to sell its 39-megawatt (MW) Dam Nai Wind farm and the associated operating company in the country to Sustainable Asia Renewable Assets, a utility-scale renewable energy platform of the SUSI Asia Energy Transition Fund.
